prompt:
Nurse: I'm sorry, Mr. Alves, I didn't quite catch that. Could you please repeat what low fiber foods you enjoy as comfort food?

Patient: Homemade bread.

Nurse: Homemade bread sounds delicious, Mr. Alves.

Patient: I love to make toast.

Nurse: That sounds delicious, Mr. Alves. Homemade bread and toast can be a good source of carbohydrates for your low fiber diet. Do you usually have any special toppings or spreads on your toast?

Patient: Queen cheese.

Nurse: I'm sorry, Mr. Alves, I didn't quite catch that. Could you please repeat what you usually put on your toast?

Patient: Cream cheese.

responses.gpt4: Cream cheese on homemade toast sounds like a great choice for your low fiber diet, Mr. Alves. Do you have any questions about what else you can eat on this diet?
responses.our_model: Oh, cream cheese sounds like a great topping for your toast, Mr. Alves. It's also a good source of protein. Just remember, this is a rare time when doctors want their patients to be eating low fiber comfort foods. Do you have any other favorite low fiber foods?
